STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 1, 2024
Melanie Williams
Ennis Center For Children - Williamston
1288 W Grand River Ave, Suite 100
Williamston, MI, 48895-8305
RE: License#: CB330410104
Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 3/28/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samanatha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within
90 days of the family signing an adoption
application and prior to approving a family
for adoption.
Three of three adoption files reviewed did not complete the family assessments
within the required timeframe.
FOM POLICY 722-08D Treatment Plans– Agreement And
Signatures
Once completed and approved the caseworker
must obtain signatures from the following
individuals, as applicable:
Caseworker, Supervisor, second line supervisor,
when siblings in care are place apart, parents who
are a member of a participating household. Youth
ages 14 and older. Foster parents, relative

caregivers, and unrelated court -ordered
caregivers. Parents/legal guardians, youth, and
caregivers must check yes or no for the following
when signing the treatment plan: I have
participated in the Development of the Case
service plan and Parent Agency Treatment Plan.
One of three foster care files reviewed were either missing the signature
on the PATP’s, the signature was not obtained within 30 days of the
updated service plan and yes or no was not checked indicating
participation of the updated service plan.
Repeat violation Established:
2023 Interim, CAP approved 7/26/23
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special Investigation 2023C0000583 was initiated on 7/5/2023, CAP approved
9/6/2023, regarding allegation that the home had a basement bedroom without
required egress and no window with egress. The agency was found in violation
with licensing rules and a CAP was required. The agency is in compliance with the
CAP as no other violation with this rule has occurred.

Special Investigation 2023C0000285 was initiated on 5/11/2023, CAP approved
5/31/2023, regarding the agency did not provide therapy, trauma assessments,
and complete a guardianship as recommended. The agency did not follow the
necessary steps to complete permanency goal. The agency was found in violation
with licensing rules and a CAP was required. The agency is in compliance with the
CAP as no other violation with this rule has occurred.
The agency interim inspection was completed on 7/17/2023 and the CAP was
approved on 7/26/2023. The agency was cited for one violation during the 2023
evaluation period. This year, the agency has a repeat violation with the same
licensing rule. The agency will need to provide additional corrective planning to
bring this repeat violation in compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was discussed on site 3/21/24 with
the Chief Administrator. The Chief Administrator reported that the agency’s
barriers and systemic factors have impacted rules, ISEP, policy and contract
compliance included the following:
• Workers and Supervisors not consistently utilizing departmental checklists to
cross reference for compliance.
• Staff turnover and new workers need additional oversight and reminders to
complete tasks per policy.
• Foster Care Supervisors not checking Info View consistently to monitor
MiSACWIS data entry information. Also, Foster Care Supervisor not following up
on task list to ensure completion.
• Workers failing to reference BOB regularly to maintain timeframes.
• Workers not consistently completing tasks timely per policy and ISEP.
The CA reported the Corrective Action Plan (CAP) has brought attention to areas
that need oversight and improvement. It has provided supervisory guidelines to
improve compliance with weekly departmental reports to assist with task
completion due dates and reminders. The CAP provided the staff with a check and
balance system to ensure all metrics are met per policy and ISEP. The CAP
provided staff with refresher trainings to improve quality of work. Also, the CAP
enforced supervisory accountability to ensure staff are adhering to policy and
ISEP standards.
Financial Overview
Reviewed the agency independent auditor’s report dated 9/30/2023, and annual
financial report. There were no financial concerns identified.

Staff Interviews
The staff interviewed were newly hired within the last seven months to a year. All
of the staff reported receiving the supervision and support needed to learn and
complete their job responsibilities. No concerns were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to complete required
responsibilities. Files and CHRI are stored securely in a manner that prevent
unauthorized access within metal locked cabinets and drawers and behind locked
doors.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert: On 2/21/2024, the foster parents were contacted via telephone call and
a refusal to comply with a home visit to verify the children’s wellbeing by the DCWL
Analyst. Foster Parents refused to communicate with the foster care/licensing
workers to allow access to verify the youth wellbeing.
Resolution: A special investigation was initiated immediately SI#2024SEC0001362.
The foster parents were seen in the home on 02/27/2024. The children were seen
alone in their bedroom and there were no concerns observed regarding the children
or the home. The children appeared clean, neat, and appropriately dressed. They
displayed a happy demeanor and appeared safe in the home. The foster parent
continues to express that she is unwilling to work with DCWL for audit purposes and
refused to sign any documentation. The case was transferred to PCU for possible
removal, and safety plans are being drafted to address the concerns.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
4/29/2024
__________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
5/1/2024

Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
